Description: Up for sale is my Epiphone ES-335 PRO. It is in like new condition, with very little play. It comes with new gig bag. I am selling because I am going to travel a lot next year and I won't have room for all my equipment. I prefer to see this beauty go to a good home. Overall, Epiphone has done a great job with this copy of the original Gibson ES-335. I consider this model the best ES-335 for the money. After this one, the only way to upgrade is getting a real Gibson or, even better, a Heritage H-535. Good luck! BTW vehicle not included! These are the specifics from the Epiphone website. Note that the fretboard is dyed rosewood and looks very cool: SPECIFICATIONSTop and Back5-ply laminated maple/birchSide3-ply laminated maple/birchNeckmahogany with dyed rosewood fretboardNeck shape1960s SlimTaper™ "D" profileNeck jointglued inTruss rodadjustableTruss rod coverblack Kalamazoo- era bell shape with "ES-335 PRO" in white and white trim on the edges of the truss rod coverScale length24.75HeadstockSloped Dovewing with "pineapple" logo and 60s era "Epiphone" script Fingerboard material: small block inlaysNeck pickupEpiphone Alnico Classic™ PRO 4-wireBridge pickupEpiphone Alnico Classic™ PRO 4-wireControls-Epiphone all-metal 3-way pickup selector-Neck pickup volume with push/pull coil-splitting-Bridge pickup volume with push/pull coil-splitting-Neck pickup tone -Bridge pickup toneBindingbody top, 1-ply (cream), body back, 1-ply (cream), fingerboard, 1-ply (cream) Fingerboard radius: 12"Frets22 medium jumboBridgeLockTone™ Tune-o-maticTailpieceStopBarNut1.68"HardwarenickelMachine HeadsWilkinson™ Vintage classics, 14:1, green 'tulip' styleColorsCherry (CH).StringsD’Addario® 10, 13, 17, 26, 36, 46
Title: Epiphone ES-335 PRO with Gig bag
ConditionDescription: Like new. Very little play. Includes new gig bag. Travelling a lot, won't have room for all my equipment and prefer to sell.
